text: I'm a developer new to everything HubSpot. I'm trying to port a blog from wordpress to HubSpot with design in tact. I have a menu that won't behave on mobile. I have included all the necessary .js and .css but it's just not working. I'm using the .html template option because that made more sense to me. It seems like I get different results when I include the .js in different places. Depending on where I put it I get a Jquery not defined error or an error with the function in the js file. Where do I begin to trouble shoot this stuff?

make sure your standard header includes (if the move jquery to footer has not been toggled under settings)
is above your js for your menu

If the move jquery to footer toggle has been toggled on, move that js file below the footer includes
Ok, thanks I will see about that. Is it pretty obvious where the "Standard header includes"are?
